perturbation.original_text: (d) Accounting Statement: Royalty statements (which statements shall be on the form attached hereto as Exhibit O and incorporated herein by this reference or such other form as the receiving party may designate in its discretion) shall be due and payments made within thirty (30) days after the close of each calendar quarter in which the paying party received any applicable revenue. Each party shall keep a record of all sales and shall submit, together with the royalty statements, a quarterly summary report of such sales. Notwithstanding the foregoing, pursuant to Paragraphs 7(b) (2) and 7(b)(3), Fox shall make all payments of revenue remitted directly by VGSL or any other CSP with whom the parties prospectively agree Fox will receive revenue directly, within thirty (30) days of receipt of such revenue.
perturbation.changed_text: (d) Accounting Statement: Royalty statements (which statements shall be on the form attached hereto as Exhibit O and incorporated herein by this reference or such other form as the receiving party may designate in its discretion) shall be due and payments made within sixty (60) days after the close of each calendar quarter in which the paying party received any applicable revenue. Each party shall keep a record of all sales and shall submit, together with the royalty statements, a quarterly summary report of such sales. Notwithstanding the foregoing, pursuant to Paragraphs 7(b) (2) and 7(b)(3), Fox shall make all payments of revenue remitted directly by VGSL or any other CSP with whom the parties prospectively agree Fox will receive revenue directly, within fifteen (15) days of receipt of such revenue.
perturbation.explanation: This perturbation introduces an in-text contradiction by modifying the payment terms for royalty statements. The first sentence states that payments should be made within **sixty (60) days**, while the 'notwithstanding' clause later says payments will be done in **fifteen (15) days** after receipt for VGSL and other CSP revenue. This creates uncertainty about the actual payment deadline and could lead to disputes.

perturbation.original_text: (f) Late Payments: If a party does not receive the applicable royalty payment as specified on or before the thirtieth day after the close of any calendar quarter, the party owing such royalty shall pay interest with respect to any royalties owed from day to day until the date of payment at a rate of 5% above U.S. Prime Rate on an annual basis. Interest on royalties owed calculated in accordance with this Paragraph shall accrue after as well as before any judgment. Neither the acceptance of any payment or royalty statement nor the deposit of any check shall preclude a party from questioning the correctness of any such payment or royalty statement at any time.
perturbation.changed_text: (f) Late Payments: If a party does not receive the applicable royalty payment as specified on or before the sixtieth day after the close of any calendar quarter, the party owing such royalty shall pay interest with respect to any royalties owed from day to day until the date of payment at a rate of 10% above U.S. Prime Rate, compounded monthly. No interest will be charged if payment is made within the calendar quarter following the period in which royalties were earned. Neither the acceptance of any payment or royalty statement nor the deposit of any check shall preclude a party from questioning the correctness of any such payment or royalty statement at any time.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction by setting the late payment term different than the one set up in 7(d) to be within 60 days. Additionally, the interest rate is changed, and an exception is made for no interest within the next calendar quarter, creating potential inconsistencies and legal ambiguities.

perturbation.original_text: (c) Guarantee Forfeiture: In the event of termination of this Agreement and without limitation of Fox’s rights and remedies all of which are expressly reserved, the following payment penalties shall apply: (i) if termination occurs in the first year of the Term, Licensee shall forfeit any Guarantee paid, and shall immediately pay any remaining Guarantee, up to the amount of ***** dollars (US$*****), and any Guarantee payments made in excess of ***** dollars ($*****) shall be refunded by Fox to Licensee; and (ii) if termination occurs in the second year of the Term, Licensee shall forfeit any Guarantee paid, and shall immediately pay any remaining portion of the Guarantee then unpaid, up to the amount of ***** dollars (US$*****). Any forfeited Guarantees will apply as a set off against any additional damages claimed by Fox.
perturbation.changed_text: (c) Guarantee Forfeiture: In the event of termination of this Agreement and without limitation of Fox’s rights and remedies all of which are expressly reserved, the following payment penalties shall apply: (i) if termination occurs in the first year of the Term, Licensee shall forfeit any Guarantee paid, and shall immediately pay any remaining Guarantee, up to the amount of ***** dollars (US$*****), and any Guarantee payments made in excess of ***** dollars ($*****) shall be refunded by Fox to Licensee; and (ii) if termination occurs in the second year of the Term, Licensee shall receive a full refund of all Guarantee payments made to Fox. Any forfeited Guarantees will apply as a set off against any additional damages claimed by Fox.
perturbation.explanation: This edit creates an in-text contradiction concerning the guarantee forfeiture upon termination. Previously, the licensee had to pay a portion of the guarantee if termination occurred in the second year. Now, it receives a refund, conflicting directly with the earlier provision and introducing ambiguity regarding financial penalties.
